1.name: The Sound of Music
1.description: A woman leaves an Austrian convent to become a governess to the children of a Naval officer widower.

2.name: In Harm's Way
2.description: A Naval officer, reprimanded after Pearl Harbor, is later promoted to Rear Admiral and gets a second chance to prove himself against the Japanese.

3.name: Doctor Zhivago
3.description: The life of a Russian physician and poet who, although married to another, falls in love with a political activist's wife and experiences hardship during World War I and then the October Revolution.

4.name: Thunderball
4.description: James Bond heads to the Bahamas to recover two nuclear warheads stolen by S.P.E.C.T.R.E. Agent Emilio Largo in an international extortion scheme.

5.name: Per qualche dollaro in più
5.description: Two bounty hunters with the same intentions team up to track down a Western outlaw.

6.name: The Sons of Katie Elder
6.description: Ranch owner Katie Elder's four sons determine to avenge the murder of their father and the swindling of their mother.

7.name: The Great Race
7.description: In the early 20th century, two rivals, the heroic Leslie and the despicable Professor Fate, engage in an epic automobile race from New York to Paris.

8.name: Cat Ballou
8.description: A young schoolteacher turns into an outlaw to avenge her murdered father.

9.name: The Sandpiper
9.description: A free-spirited single mother forms a connection with the wed headmaster of an Episcopal boarding school in California.

10.name: Repulsion
10.description: A sex-repulsed woman who disapproves of her sister's boyfriend sinks into depression and has horrific visions of rape and violence.

11.name: A Patch of Blue
11.description: A blind, uneducated white girl is befriended by a black man, who becomes determined to help her escape her impoverished and abusive home life by introducing her to the outside world.

12.name: Pierrot le Fou
12.description: Pierrot escapes his boring society and travels from Paris to the Mediterranean Sea with Marianne, a girl chased by hit-men from Algeria. They lead an unorthodox life, always on the run.

13.name: The Greatest Story Ever Told
13.description: An all-star, large scale epic movie that chronicles the life and ministry of Jesus Christ.

14.name: That Darn Cat!
14.description: After a kidnapped bank teller uses a neighbor's wandering cat to send an SOS, the FBI assigns a cat-allergic agent to the case.

15.name: The Collector
15.description: A man kidnaps a woman and holds her hostage just for the pleasure of having her there.

16.name: Darling
16.description: Beautiful, but amoral, model Diana Scott (Julie Christie) sleeps her way to the top of the London fashion scene at the height of the Swinging Sixties.

17.name: Faster, Pussycat! Kill! Kill!
17.description: Three go-go dancers holding a young girl hostage come across a crippled old man living with his two sons in the desert. After learning he's hiding a sum of cash around, the women start scheming on him.

18.name: The Heroes of Telemark
18.description: Norwegian resistance tries to stop German efforts to produce an atomic bomb component during World War II.

19.name: Giulietta degli spiriti
19.description: Visions, memories, and mysticism all help a 40-something woman to find the strength to leave her cheating husband.

20.name: War-Gods of the Deep
20.description: In 1903, in Cornwall, a group of locals discover an underwater city, dating back to 1803, that hides a society of smugglers and aquatic creatures.

21.name: Battle of the Bulge
21.description: A dramatization of Nazi Germany's final Western Front counterattack of World War II.

22.name: The Flight of the Phoenix
22.description: After a plane crash in the Sahara, one of the survivors says he's an airplane designer and they can make a flyable plane from the wreckage.

23.name: Alphaville, une étrange aventure de Lemmy Caution
23.description: A U.S. secret agent is sent to the distant space city of Alphaville where he must find a missing person and free the city from its tyrannical ruler.

24.name: The Spy Who Came In from the Cold
24.description: British Agent Alec Leamas (Richard Burton) refuses to come in from the Cold War during the 1960s, choosing to face another mission, which may prove to be his final one.

25.name: The Big Job
25.description: An inept gang of bank robbers, led by George The Brain, are caught and sentenced to 15 years hard labour each. When they are released from prison they start out to collect the money they ...                See full summary »

26.name: Help!
26.description: Sir Ringo Starr finds himself the human sacrifice target of a cult, and his fellow members of The Beatles must try to protect him from it.

27.name: The Ipcress File
27.description: In London, a counter espionage Agent deals with his own bureaucracy while investigating the kidnapping and brainwashing of British scientists.

28.name: Operatsiya 'Y' i drugie priklyucheniya Shurika
28.description: Three stories about Shurik - a young student. He fights against criminals, falls in love, confuses apartments, passes exams - he lives after all.

29.name: Ship of Fools
29.description: A varied group of passengers boarding a ship bound for pre-WWII Germany represents a microcosm of early 1930s society.

30.name: The Cincinnati Kid
30.description: An up-and-coming poker player tries to prove himself in a high-stakes match against a long-time master of the game.

31.name: Terrore nello spazio
31.description: After landing on a mysterious planet, a team of astronauts begin to turn on each other, swayed by the uncertain influence of the planet and its strange inhabitants.

32.name: What's New Pussycat
32.description: A playboy who refuses to give up his hedonistic lifestyle to settle down and marry his true love seeks help from a demented psychoanalyst who is having romantic problems of his own.

33.name: Village of the Giants
33.description: Delinquent teen-agers ingest a substance and grow thirty feet tall, then proceed to take over a small town.

34.name: Those Magnificent Men in Their Flying Machines or How I Flew from London to Paris in 25 hours 11 minutes
34.description: Hoping to push Britain to the forefront of aviation, a London publisher organizes an international air race across the English Channel, but must contend with two entrants vying for his daughter, as well as national rivalries and cheating.

35.name: The Hallelujah Trail
35.description: On its way to Denver, a cargo of whiskey destined for the miners, is sought after by the Temperance League, the U.S. Cavalry, the local Indians and the miners themselves.

36.name: Akahige
36.description: In 19th-century Japan, a rough-tempered yet charitable town doctor trains a young intern.

37.name: Major Dundee
37.description: In 1864, due to frequent Apache raids from Mexico into the U.S., a Union officer decides to illegally cross the border and destroy the Apache, using a mixed army of Union troops, Confederate POWs, civilian mercenaries, and scouts.

38.name: Von Ryan's Express
38.description: An American POW leads a group of mainly British prisoners to escape from the Germans in WWII.

39.name: She
39.description: An Edwardian archaeologist and two companions stumble upon a lost city in East Africa, run by a beautiful queen whose love holds the promise of immortality.

40.name: The Hill
40.description: In a North African military prison during World War II, five new prisoners struggle to survive in the face of brutal punishment and sadistic guards.

41.name: Life at the Top
41.description: Joe Lampton thought he had really made it by marrying the boss's daughter in his northern mill town. But he finds he is being sidelined at work and his private life manipulated by his father-in-law.

42.name: Shenandoah
42.description: During the Civil War, a Virginia farmer and his family vow to remain neutral, but one of the sons is captured by Union soldiers, sending the farmer to his rescue.

43.name: Lord Jim
43.description: After being discredited as a coward, a 19th century seaman (Peter O'Toole) lives for only one purpose: to redeem himself. Based on Joseph Conrad's novel written in 1900.

44.name: Dr. Terror's House of Horrors
44.description: Aboard a British train, mysterious fortune teller Dr. Schreck uses tarot cards to read the futures of five fellow passengers.

45.name: Le bonheur
45.description: François, a young carpenter, lives a happy, uncomplicated life with his wife Thérèse and their two small children. One day he meets Emilie, a clerk in the local post office.

46.name: Bunny Lake Is Missing
46.description: A woman reports that her young daughter is missing, but there seems to be no evidence that she ever existed.

47.name: Ten Little Indians
47.description: Ten people are invited to a luxury mountaintop mansion, only to find that an unseen person is killing them one by one. Could one of them be the killer?

48.name: Campanadas a medianoche
48.description: The career of Shakespeare's Sir John Falstaff (Orson Welles) as a roistering companion to young Prince Hal (Keith Baxter), circa 1400 to 1413.

49.name: The War Lord
49.description: In 11th century Normandy, a Norman duke sends one of his knights to build a defensive fortress in order to guard the borders against Frisian raiders.

50.name: Young Dillinger
50.description: John Dillinger first goes to jail after attempting to rob his girlfriend's father at her suggestion. Falling in with the likes of "Baby Face" Nelson and "Pretty Boy" Floyd, he arranges ...                See full summary »
